Lifecycle Manager Edit on GitHub

Conceptually there is a seam between the rest of the application (imperative code that mutates state) and the top-level component (below which everything is functional and immutable).

This seam is managed by the CKComponentLifecycleManager.

typedef CKComponent *(^CKComponentFactory)(id model, CKComponentState *state);

@interface CKComponentLifecycleManager

/**
 @param model The state of the outside world. Passed to the factory.
 @param componentFactory A block that generates a component.
 */
- (instancetype)initWithModel:(id)model
             componentFactory:(CKComponentFactory)componentFactory;

/**
 Call this when the the state of the outside world changes.
 This asynchronously recomputes the component with the new model, then mounts it.
 */
- (void)replaceModel:(id)newModel;

- (void)mountInView:(UIView *)view;

- (void)unmount;

@end

This object also encapsulates the asynchronous computation of updated components on a background thread.

Note that React has a similar seam when integrating with external, non-reactive Javascript. It has an almost-identical API called replaceProps: (our replaceModel:).
